alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued March 01 at 3:45AM PST until March 02 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures of 24 to 30 degrees expected. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County, Northern Sacramento Valley, Central Sacramento Valley, Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County, Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Motherlode. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, until 8 AM PST this morning. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
